name: WOQL
description:
The WOQL object is a wrapper around the WOQLQuery object
Syntactic sugar to allow writing WOQL.triple()... instead of new WOQLQuery().triple()
Every function matches one of the public api functions of the woql query object

name: eval
description: Evaluates the passed arithmetic expression and generates or matches the result value

params.description: query or JSON-LD representing the query
params.name: arithExp

params.description: output variable
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: WOQLQuery

name: using
description: Query running against any specific commit Id

params.description: path to specific reference Id or commit Id
params.name: refPath

params.description: subquery for the specific commit point
params.name: subquery

name: comment
description: Adds a text comment to a query - can also be used to wrap any part of a query to turn it off

params.description: text comment
params.name: comment

params.description: query that is "commented out"
params.name: subquery

name: select

params.description: only these variables are returned
params.name: varNames

examples:
WOQL.select("v:a",triple("v:a","v:b","v:c"))
Filters the query so that only the variables included in [V1...Vn] are returned in the bindings

name: distinct
description: Filter the query to return only results that are distinct in the given variables

params.description: these variables are guaranteed to be unique as a tuple
params.name: varNames

name: and
description: Logical conjunction of the contained queries - all queries must match or the entire clause fails

params.description: A list of one or more woql queries to execute as a conjunction
params.name: subqueries

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery object containing the conjunction of queries

name: or
description: Creates a logical OR of the arguments

params.description: A list of one or more woql queries to execute as alternatives
params.name: subqueries

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery object containing the logical Or of the subqueries

name: from
description: Specifies the database URL that will be the default database for the enclosed query

params.description: A valid graph resource identifier string
params.name: graphRef-

params.description: The query
params.name: query

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the from expression

name: into
description: Specifies the graph resource to write the contained query into

params.description: A valid graph resource identifier string
params.name: graphRef-

params.description: The query which will be written into the graph
params.name: subquery

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which will be written into the graph in question

name: triple
description: Creates a triple pattern matching rule for the triple [S, P, O] (Subject, Predicate, Object)

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

name: added_triple
description: Creates a triple pattern matching rule for the triple [S, P, O] (Subject, Predicate, Object) added in the current layer

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

name: removed_triple
description: Creates a triple pattern matching rule for the triple [S, P, O] (Subject, Predicate, Object) added in the current commit

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

name: quad
description: Creates a pattern matching rule for the quad [S, P, O, G] (Subject, Predicate, Object, Graph)

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

params.description: A valid graph resource identifier string
params.name: graphRef

name: added_quad
description: Creates a pattern matching rule for the quad [S, P, O, G] (Subject, Predicate, Object, Graph) removed from the current commit

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

params.description: A valid graph resource identifier string
params.name: graphRef-

name: removed_quad
description: Creates a pattern matching rule for the quad [S, P, O, G] (Subject, Predicate, Object, Graph) removed from the current commit

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

params.description: A valid graph resource identifier string
params.name: graphRef-

name: sub
description: Returns true if ClassA subsumes ClassB, according to the current DB schema

params.description: ClassA
params.name: classA

params.description: ClassB
params.name: classB

returns.description: WOQLQuery

name: eq
description: Matches if a is equal to b

params.description: literal, variable or id
params.name: varName

params.description: literal, variable or id
params.name: varValue

name: substr
description: Substring

params.description: String or variable
params.name: string

params.description: integer or variable (characters from start to begin)
params.name: before

params.description: integer or variable (length of substring)
params.name: length

params.description: integer or variable (number of characters after substring)
params.name: after

params.description: String or variable
params.name: substring

name: update_object
description: Updates a document (or any object) in the db with the passed copy

params.description: JSON-LD document
params.name: JSON

name: delete_object
description: Deletes a node identified by an IRI or a JSON-LD document

params.description: IRI or a JSON-LD document
params.name: JSON_or_IRI

name: read_object
description: Saves the entire document with IRI DocumentIRI into the JSONLD variable

params.description: either an IRI literal or a variable containing an IRI
params.name: IRI

params.description: a variable into which the document’s will be saved
params.name: output

params.description: the export format descriptor, default value is JSON-LD
params.name: formatObj

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the document retrieval expression

name: get
description: Retrieves the exernal resource defined by QueryResource and copies values from it into variables defined in AsVars

params.description: an array of AsVar variable mappings (see as for format below)
params.name: asvars

params.description: an external resource (remote, file, post) to query
params.name: queryResource

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the get expression

name: put

params.description: an array of AsVar variable mappings (see as for format below)
params.name: varsToExp

params.description: The query which will be executed to produce the results
params.name: query

params.description: an file resource local to the server
params.name: fileResource

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the put expression

customTags.value: Outputs the results of a query to a file

name: as
description: Imports the value identified by Source to a Target variable

params.description: Source
params.name: source

params.description: Target
params.name: target

params.description: type to cast value to string|number etc...
params.name: type

examples:
WOQL.as("first var", "v:First_Var", "string").as("second var", "v:Second_Var")
 WOQL.as(["first var", "v:First_Var", "string"], ["second var", "v:Second_Var"])

name: remote
description: Identifies a remote resource by URL and specifies the format of the resource through the options

params.description: The URL at which the remote resource can be accessed
params.name: url

params.description: The format of the resource data {}
params.name: formatObj

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the remote resource identifier

name: file
description: Identifies a file resource as a path on the server and specifies the format through the options

params.description: The Path on the server at which the file resource can be accessed
params.name: url

params.description: imput options
params.name: formatObj

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the file resource identifier

name: post
description:
Identifies a resource as a local path on the client, to be sent to the server through a
HTTP POST request, with the format defined through the options

params.description: The Path on the server at which the file resource can be accessed
params.name: url

params.description: imput options, optional
params.name: formatObj

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Post resource identifier

name: delete_triple
description: Deletes a single triple from the default graph of the database

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the Triple Deletion statement

name: delete_quad
description: Deletes a single triple from the graph [Subject, Predicate, Object, Graph]

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

params.description: A valid graph resource identifier string
params.name: graphRef

examples:
remove the class Person from the schema/main graph
WOQL.delete_quad("Person", "type", "owl:Class", "schema/main")

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the Delete Quad Statement

name: add_triple
description: Adds triples according to the the pattern [subject,predicate,object]

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

returns.description: WOQLQuery

name: add_quad
description: Adds quads according to the pattern [S,P,O,G]

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

params.description: A valid graph resource identifier string
params.name: graphRef-

returns.description: WOQLQuery

name: when
description: When the subquery is met, the update query is executed

params.description: the condition query
params.name: subquery

returns.description: -  A WOQLQuery which contains the when expression

name: trim
description: Remove whitespace from both sides of a string:

params.description: A string or variable containing the untrimmed version of the string
params.name: inputStr

params.description: A string or variable containing the trimmed version of the string
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Trim pattern matching expression

name: evaluate
description: Evaluates the passed arithmetic expression and generates or matches the result value

params.description: A WOQL query containing a valid WOQL Arithmetic Expression, which is evaluated by the function
params.name: arithExp

params.description: Either a variable, in which the result of the expression will be stored, or a numeric literal which will be used as a test of result of the evaluated expression
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Arithmetic function

name: plus
description: Adds the numbers together

params.description: a variable or numeric containing the values to add
params.name: args

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the addition expression

name: minus
description: Subtracts Numbers N1..Nn

params.description: variable or numeric containing the value that will be subtracted from
params.name: args

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the subtraction expression

name: times
description: Multiplies numbers N1...Nn together

params.description: a variable or numeric containing the value
params.name: args

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the multiplication expression

name: divide
description: Divides numbers N1...Nn by each other left, to right precedence

params.description: numbers to tbe divided
params.name: args

name: div
description: Division - integer division - args are divided left to right

params.description: numbers for division
params.name: args

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the division expression

name: exp
description: Exponent - raises varNum01 to the power of varNum02

params.description: a variable or numeric containing the number to be raised to the power of the second number
params.name: varNum

params.description: a variable or numeric containing the exponent
params.name: expNum

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the exponent expression

name: floor
description: Generates the nearest lower integer to the passed number

params.description: Variable or numeric containing the number to be floored
params.name: varNum

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the floor expression

name: isa
description: Tests whether a given instance IRI has type Class, according to the current state of the DB

params.description: A string IRI or a variable that identify the class instance
params.name: instanceIRI

params.description: A Class IRI or a variable
params.name: classId

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the type test

name: like
description: Generates a string Leverstein distance measure between stringA and stringB

params.description: string literal or variable representing a string to be compared
params.name: stringA

params.description: string literal or variable representing the other string to be compared
params.name: stringB

params.description: variable representing the distance between the variables
params.name: distance

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Like pattern matching expression

name: less
description: Compares the value of v1 against v2 and returns true if v1 is less than v2

params.description: a variable or numeric containing the number to be compared
params.name: varNum01

params.description: a variable or numeric containing the second comporator
params.name: varNum02

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the comparison expression

name: greater
description: Compares the value of v1 against v2 and returns true if v1 is greater than v2

params.description: a variable or numeric containing the number to be compared
params.name: varNum01

params.description: a variable or numeric containing the second comporator
params.name: varNum02

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the comparison expression

name: opt
description: Specifies that the Subquery is optional - if it does not match the query will not fail

params.description: A subquery which will be optionally matched
params.name: subquery

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the optional sub Query

name: unique
description: Generate a new IRI from the prefix and a hash of the variables which will be unique for any given combination of variables

params.description: A prefix for the IRI - typically formed of the doc prefix and the classtype of the entity (“doc:Person”)
params.name: prefix

params.description: An array of variables and / or strings from which the unique hash will be generated
params.name: inputVarList

params.description: Variable in which the unique ID is stored
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the unique ID generating function

name: idgen
description: Generate a new IRI from the prefix and concatention of the variables

params.description: A prefix for the IRI - typically formed of the doc prefix and the classtype of the entity (“doc:Person”)
params.name: prefix

params.description: An array of variables and / or strings from which the unique hash will be generated
params.name: inputVarList

params.description: Variable in which the unique ID is stored
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the ID generating function

name: upper
description: Changes a string to upper-case

params.description: string or variable representing the uncapitalized string
params.name: inputVarName

params.description: variable that stores the capitalized string output
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Upper case pattern matching expression

name: lower
description: Changes a string to lower-case

params.description: string or variable representing the non-lowercased string
params.name: inputVarName

params.description: variable that stores the lowercased string output
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Lower case pattern matching expression

name: pad
description: Pads out the string input to be exactly len long by appending the pad character pad to form output

params.description: The input string or variable in unpadded state
params.name: inputVarName

params.description: The characters to use to pad the string or a variable representing them
params.name: pad

params.description: The variable or integer value representing the length of the output string
params.name: len

params.description: stores output
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Pad pattern matching expression

name: split
description: Splits a string (Input) into a list strings (Output) by removing separator

params.description: A string or variable representing the unsplit string
params.name: inputVarName

params.description: A string or variable containing a sequence of charatcters to use as a separator
params.name: separator

params.description: variable that stores output list
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Split pattern matching expression

name: member
description: Matches if List includes Element

params.description: Either a variable, IRI or any simple datatype
params.name: element

params.description: List ([string, literal] or string*) Either a variable representing a list or a list of variables or literals
params.name: list

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the List inclusion pattern matching expression

name: concat
description: takes a variable number of string arguments and concatenates them into a single string

params.description: a variable representing a list or a list of variables or strings - variables can be embedded in the string if they do not contain spaces
params.name: varList

params.description: A variable or string containing the output string
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Concatenation pattern matching expression

name: join
description: Joins a list variable together (Input) into a string variable (Output) by glueing the strings together with Glue

params.description: a variable representing a list or a list of strings and / or variables
params.name: varList

params.description: A variable (v:glue) or (glue) string representing the characters to put in between the joined strings in input
params.name: glue

params.description: A variable or string containing the output string
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Join pattern matching expression

name: sum
description: computes the sum of the List of values passed. In contrast to other arithmetic functions, sum self-evaluates - it does not have to be passed to evaluate()

params.description: a subquery or ([string or numeric]) - a list variable, or a list of variables or numeric literals
params.name: subquery

params.description: the variable name with the sum result of the values in List
params.name: total

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the Sum expression

name: start
description: Specifies an offset position in the results to start listing results from

params.description: A variable that refers to an interger or an integer literal
params.name: start

params.description: WOQL Query object, you can pass a subquery as an argument or a chained query
params.name: subquery

examples:
let [a, b, c] = vars("a", "b", "c")
start(100).triple(a, b, c)

returns.description: A WOQLQuery whose results will be returned starting from the specified offset

name: limit
description: Specifies a maximum number of results that will be returned from the subquery

params.description: A variable that refers to an non-negative integer or a non-negative integer
params.name: limit

params.description: A subquery whose results will be limited
params.name: subquery

returns.description: A WOQLQuery whose results will be returned starting from the specified offset

name: re
description: Matches the regular expression defined in Patern against the Test string, to produce the matched patterns in Matches

params.description: string or variable using normal PCRE regular expression syntax with the exception that special characters have to be escaped twice (to enable transport in JSONLD)
params.name: pattern

params.description: string or variable containing the string to be tested for patterns with the regex
params.name: inputVarName

params.description: variable representing the list of matches or a list of strings or variables
params.name: resultVarList

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Regular Expression pattern matching expression

name: length
description: Calculates the length of the list in va and stores it in vb

params.description: Either a variable representing a list or a list of variables or literals
params.name: inputVarList

params.description: A variable in which the length of the list is stored or the length of the list as a non-negative integer
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the Length pattern matching expression

name: not
description: Logical negation of the contained subquery - if the subquery matches, the query will fail to match

params.description: A subquery which will be negated
params.name: subquery

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the negated sub Query

name: once
description: Results in one solution of the subqueries

params.description: WOQL Query objects
params.name: subquery

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the once sub Query

name: immediately
description: Runs the query without backtracking on side-effects

params.description: WOQL Query objects
params.name: subquery

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the immediately sub Query

name: count
description: Creates a count of the results of the query

params.description: variable or integer count
params.name: countVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the count sub Query

name: typecast
description: Casts the value of Input to a new value of type Type and stores the result in CastVar

params.description: Either a single variable or a literal of any basic type
params.name: varName

params.description: Either a variable or a basic datatype (xsd / xdd)
params.name: varType

params.description: save the return variable
params.name: resultVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the casting expression

name: order_by
description: Orders the results of the contained subquery by a precedence list of variables

params.description: A sequence of variables, by which to order the results, each optionally followed by either “asc” or “desc” to represent order
params.name: varNames

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the ordering expression

name: group_by
description: Groups the results of the contained subquery on the basis of identical values for Groupvars, extracts the patterns defined in PatternVars and stores the results in GroupedVar

params.description: Either a single variable or an array of variables
params.name: varList

params.description: Either a single variable or an array of variables
params.name: patternVars

params.description: output variable name
params.name: resultVarName

params.description: The query whose results will be grouped
params.name: subquery

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the grouping expression

name: true
description: A function that always matches, always returns true

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the true value that will match any pattern

name: path
description: Performs a path regular expression match on the graph

params.description: An IRI or variable that refers to an IRI representing the subject, i.e. the starting point of the path
params.name: subject

params.description:
(string) - A path regular expression describing a pattern through multiple edges of the graph
Path regular expressions consist of a sequence of predicates and / or a set of alternatives, with quantification operators
The characters that are interpreted specially are the following:
| representing alternative choices
, - representing a sequence of predcitates
+ - Representing a quantification of 1 or more of the preceding pattern in a sequence
{min, max} - Representing at least min examples and at most max examples of the preceding pattern
- Representing any predicate
() - Parentheses, interpreted in the normal way to group clauses
params.name: pattern

params.description: An IRI or variable that refers to an IRI representing the object, i.e. ending point of the path
params.name: object

params.description: A variable in which the actual paths traversed will be stored
params.name: resultVarName

examples:
let [person, grand_uncle, lineage] = vars("person", "grand uncle", "lineage")
path(person, ((father|mother) {2,2}), brother), grand_uncle, lineage)

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the path regular expression matching expression

name: size
description: Calculates the size in bytes of the contents of the resource identified in ResourceID

params.description: A valid resource identifier string (can refer to any graph / branch / commit / db)
params.name: resourceId

params.description: The variable name
params.name: resultVarName

examples:
size("admin/minecraft/local/branch/main/instance/main", "v:varSize")
//returns the number of bytes in the main instance graph on the main branch

name: triple_count
description: Calculates the number of triples of the contents of the resource identified in ResourceID

params.description: A valid resource identifier string (can refer to any graph / branch / commit / db)
params.name: resourceId

params.description: An integer literal with the size in bytes or a variable containing that integer
params.name: tripleCount

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the size expression

name: type_of
description: Returns true if 'elementId' is of type 'elementType', according to the current DB schema

params.description: the id of a schema graph element
params.name: elementId

params.description: the element type
params.name: elementType

returns.description: A WOQLQuery object containing the type_of pattern matching rule

name: star
description: Generates a query that by default matches all triples in a graph identified by "graph" or in all the current terminusDB's graph

params.description: false or the resource identifier of a graph possible value are schema/{main - myschema - *} | instance/{main - myschema - *}  | inference/{main - myschema - *}
params.name: graph

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable,  default value "v:Subject"
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable, default value "v:Predicate"
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal,  default value "v:Object"
params.name: object

examples:
star("schema/main")
//will return every triple in schema/main graph

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the pattern matching expression

name: all
description: Generates a query that by default matches all triples in a graph - identical to star() except for order of arguments

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

params.description: the resource identifier of a graph possible value are schema/{main - myschema - *} | instance/{main - myschema - *}  | inference/{main - myschema - *}
params.name: graphRef

name: node
description: Specifies the identity of a node that can then be used in subsequent builder functions. Note that node() requires subsequent chained functions to complete the triples / quads that it produces - by itself it only generates the subject.

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable containing an IRI which will be the subject of the builder functions
params.name: nodeid

params.description: Optional type of builder function to build  (default is triple)
params.name: chainType

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the partial Node pattern matching expression

name: insert
description: Inserts a single triple into the database declaring the Node to have type Type, optionally into the specified graph

params.description: IRI string or variable containing the IRI of the node to be inserted
params.name: classId

params.description: IRI string or variable containing the IRI of the type of the node (class/document name)
params.name: classType

params.description: Optional Graph resource identifier
params.name: graphRef

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the insert expression

name: schema
description: Generates an empty query object - identical to query - included for backwards compatibility as before v3.0, the schema functions were in their own namespace.

params.description: Resource String identifying the graph which will be used for subsequent chained schema calls
params.name: graphRef

returns.description: An empty WOQLQuery with the internal schema graph pointes set to Graph

name: graph
description: Sets the graph resource ID that will be used for subsequent chained function calls

params.description: Resource String identifying the graph which will be used for subsequent chained schema calls
params.name: graphRef

examples:
node("MyClass", "AddQuad").graph("schema/main").label("My Class Label")
//equivalent to add_quad("MyClass", "label", "My Class Label", "schema/main")

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the partial Graph pattern matching expression

name: add_class
description: Generates a new Class with the given ClassID and writes it to the DB schema

params.description: IRI or variable containing IRI of the new class to be added (prefix default to scm)
params.name: classId

params.description: Optional Resource String identifying the schema graph into which the class definition will be written
params.name: schemaGraph

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the add class expression

name: add_property
description: Generates a new Property with the given PropertyID and a range of type and writes it to the DB schema

params.description: IRI or variable containing IRI of the new property to be added (prefix default to scm)
params.name: propId

params.description: optional IRI or variable containing IRI of the range type of the new property (defaults to xsd:string)
params.name: propType

params.description: Optional Resource String identifying the schema graph into which the property definition will be written
params.name: schemaGraph

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the add property expression

name: delete_class
description: Deletes the Class with the passed ID form the schema (and all references to it)

params.description: IRI or variable containing IRI of the class to be deleted (prefix default to scm)
params.name: classId

params.description: Optional Resource String identifying the schema graph
params.name: schemaGraph

params.description: The var name, default value "v:Class"
params.name: classVarName

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the class deletion expression

name: delete_property
description: Deletes a property from the schema and all its references incoming and outgoing

params.description: IRI or a variable containing IRI of the property to be deleted (prefix defaults to scm)
params.name: propId

params.description: Resource String identifying the schema graph from which the property definition will be deleted
params.name: schemaGraph

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the property deletion expression

name: doctype
description: Creates a new document class in the schema

params.description: IRI or variable containing IRI of the new document class to be added (prefix default to scm)
params.name: classId

params.description: Resource String identifying the schema graph from which the document definition will be added
params.name: schemaGraph

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the add document class expression

name: insert_data
description: Inserts data as an object - enabling multiple property values to be inserted in one go

params.description:
json object which contains fields:
mandatory: id, type
optional: label, description, [property] (valid property ids)
params.name: dataObj

params.description: al graph resource identifier (defaults to “instance/main” if no using or into is specified)
params.name: instanceGraph

examples:
let data = {id: "doc:joe",
  type: "Person",
  label: "Joe",
  description: "My friend Joe",
  age: 42
 }
 insert_data(data)

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the insertion expression

name: insert_class_data
description: Inserts data about a class as a json object - enabling a class and all its properties to be specified in a single function

params.description: with id, label, description, parent and properties
params.name: classObj

params.description: the resource identifier of a schema graph. The Default value is schema/main
params.name: schemaGraph

examples:
let data = { id: "Robot", label: "Robot", parent: ["MyClass001", "MyClass002"]}
insert_class_data(data)

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the insertion expression

name: insert_doctype_data
description: Inserts data about a class as a json object - enabling a class and all its properties to be specified in a single function

params.description: with id, label, description, parent and properties
params.name: classObj

params.description: the resource identifier of a schema graph. The Default value is schema/main
params.name: schemaGraph

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the insertion expression

name: insert_property_data
description: Inserts data about a document class as a json object - enabling a document class and all its properties to be specified in a single function

params.description: json object which contains fields:
params.name: propObj

params.description: the resource identifier of a schema graph. The Default value id schema/main
params.name: schemaGraph

examples:
let data = {
  id: "prop",
  label: "Property",
  description: "prop desc",
  range: "X",
  domain: "X",
  max: 2,
  min: 1}
  insert_property_data(data)

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the insertion expression

name: nuke
description: Deletes all triples in the passed graph (defaults to instance/main)

params.description: Resource String identifying the graph from which all triples will be removed
params.name: graphRef

examples:
nuke("schema/main")
//will delete everything from the schema/main graph

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the deletion expression

name: query
description: Generates an empty WOQLQuery object

name: json
description: Generates a WOQLQuery object from the passed WOQL JSON - if an argument is passed, the query object is created from it, if none is passed, the current state is returned as a JSON-LD

params.description: JSON-LD woql document encoding a query
params.name: JSON_LD

returns.description:
either a JSON-LD or a WOQLQuery object

json version of query for passing to api

name: string
description: Generates explicitly a JSON-LD string literal from the input

params.description: any primitive literal type
params.name: val

returns.description: - A JSON-LD string literal

name: literal
description: Generates explicitly a JSON-LD string literal from the input

params.description: any literal type
params.name: val

params.description: an xsd or xdd type
params.name: type

returns.description: - A JSON-LD literal

name: iri
description: Explicitly sets a value to be an IRI - avoiding automatic type marshalling

params.description: string which will be treated as an IRI
params.name: val

returns.description: - A JSON-LD IRI value

name: vars
description: Generates javascript variables for use as WOQL variables within a query
examples:
const [a, b, c] = WOQL.vars("a", "b", "c")
//a, b, c are javascript variables which can be used as WOQL variables in subsequent queries

returns.description: an array of javascript variables which can be dereferenced using the array destructuring operation

name: client
description: Gets/Sets woqlClient

name: emerge
description:
query module
allow you to use WOQL words as top level functions

name: update_triple
description: Update a pattern matching rule for the triple (Subject, Predicate, oldObjValue) with the new one (Subject, Predicate, newObjValue)

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The value to update or a literal
params.name: newObjValue

params.description: The old value of the object
params.name: oldObjValue

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the a Update Triple Statement

name: update_quad
description: Update a pattern matching rule for the quad [S, P, O, G] (Subject, Predicate, Object, Graph)

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The value to update or a literal
params.name: newObject

params.description: A valid graph resource identifier string
params.name: graphRef

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the a Update Quad Statement

name: value
description:
Creates a pattern matching rule for a quad [Subject, Predicate, Object, Graph] or for a triple [Subject, Predicate, Object]
add extra information about the type of the value object

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: an specific value
params.name: objValue

params.description: the resource identifier of a graph possible value are schema/{main - myschema - *} | instance/{main - myschema - *}  | inference/{main - myschema - *}
params.name: graphRef

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the a quad or a triple Statement

name: link
description: Creates a pattern matching rule for a quad [Subject, Predicate, Object, Graph] or for a triple [Subject, Predicate, Object]

params.description: The IRI of a triple’s subject or a variable
params.name: subject

params.description: The IRI of a property or a variable
params.name: predicate

params.description: The IRI of a node or a variable, or a literal
params.name: object

params.description: the resource identifier of a graph possible value are schema/{main - myschema - *} | instance/{main - myschema - *}  | inference/{main - myschema - *}
params.name: graphRef

returns.description: A WOQLQuery which contains the a quad or a triple Statement

params.description: an WoqlClient instance
params.name: woqlClient

params.description: property id
params.name: propId

params.description: the enum class id
params.name: classId

params.description: the enum class label
params.name: classLabel

params.description: the enum class description
params.name: classDesc

params.description: the resource identifier of a schema graph. The Default value id schema/main
params.name: schemaGraph

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the Create Enum Class Statement

name: generateChoiceList
description: Generates a class representing a choice list - an enumerated list of specific options

params.description: the enum class id
params.name: classId

params.description: the enum class label
params.name: classLabel

params.description: the enum class description
params.name: classDesc

params.description: an list of permitted values [[id,label,comment],[id,label,comment]]
params.name: choices

params.description: the resource identifier of a schema graph. The Default value id schema/main
params.name: schemaGraph

params.description: the id of a class that this class inherits from (e.g. scm:Enumerated)
params.name: parent

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the Generate Enum/Choice Class Statement

name: updateChoiceList
description: update or create an enumeration class. You have to add at least one permitted values in the list

params.description: the enum class id
params.name: classId

params.description: the enum class label
params.name: classLabel

params.description: the enum class description
params.name: classDesc

params.description: an list of permitted values [[id,label,comment],[id,label,comment]]
params.name: choices

params.description: the resource identifier of a schema graph. The Default value id schema/main
params.name: schemaGraph

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the Update Enum/Choice Class Statement

name: deleteChoiceList
description: delete the enum list for a specific enumeration class, but not the class

params.description: the enum class name
params.name: classId

params.description: the resource identifier of a schema graph. The Default value id schema/main
params.name: schemaGraph

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the Delete Choice List Statement

name: libs
description: Called to load Terminus Predefined libraries:

params.description: xsd,xdd,box
params.name: libs

params.description: -graph ref
params.name: graph

params.description: -prefix you want use
params.name: prefix

name: boxClasses
description: creating a structure ScopedMyClass -> myClass -> MyClass

params.description: the url prefix that will be used for the boxed types (default scm:)
params.name: prefix

params.description: the classes to box - these classes and all their subclasses will have special boxed classes created around them
params.name: classes

params.description: the exceptions - these classes and their subclasses will not be boxed, even if they are included in the above array
params.name: except

params.description: the resource identifier of a schema graph. The Default value id schema/main
params.name: schemaGraph

returns.description: - A WOQLQuery which contains the Box Classes Creating Statement
